RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 1 5F Turf CR: 85. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 18800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 19 Allowed 3 lbs. Cl aiming Price $12,500 (Claiming Races For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Estimating Allowances)(W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility). (If necessary will be run SAME DISTANCE Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NITRO TIME chased the pace through the turn vying all out four then five wide down the lane drawing even late getting a nose down on the wire. BUTTON BOX broke sharply to the lead posting quick splits to upper stretch digging in from the two path there continuing to respond late just missing in a gutty effort. RESCUE FIVE went evenly through the turn racing inside to upper stretch finishing well near the rail. AW ITE tracked evenly through the turn extending into upper stretch needing a bit more at the end. SHOSHA a step slow through the turn gave an even finish. UNBRIDLEDSELECTION raced evenly in mid pack failing to menace from mid track down the lane. HONKY TONK HERO was not involved racing eight wide down the lane. OMEGA GOLD and MON CAMO were always outrun. GATES OF HEAVEN showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Honky Tonk Hero
ENTRY.COMMENT: not involved, 8 wide lane

ENTRY.NAME: Mon Camo
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Shosha
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Rescue Five
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, inside to lane, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Aw Ite
ENTRY.OWNER: Inman Betty Tunstall Shirley and Tunstall James
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked evenly, extended to lane, needed a bit more

ENTRY.NAME: Omega Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Unbridledselection
ENTRY.OWNER: Bernardini Jay P and Navy Chief's Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, lacked more

ENTRY.NAME: Button Box
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, set pace, dug in two path lane, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Gates of Heaven
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Nitro Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, bid 4-5 wide lane, surged late nose down on wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 2 7 1/2F Turf CR: 87. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE ON THE TURF. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 19 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000. (If necessary will be run ONE MILE Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SEVEN AND SEVEN sent clear was rated on pace moving between horses in upper stretch digging in to outside pressure in the closing strides holding on at the wire. TAMANRASSETT steadied into the first turn stalked the pace chasing to upper stretch appearing to be hanging in mid stretch finding a late surge on the outside just missing at the wire. HOLY TRUTH raced evenly through the far turn angling out to upper stretch gaining late in the six path. KNOWN unhurried early would save ground waiting for room into the far turn angling out in upper stretch finding best stride too late at mid track. PAISANO tracked the pace cutting the corner to vie boldly from the rail in upper stretch before weakening the final sixteenth. UNCLE JEROME was not involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Known
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, waited into far turn, angled out lane, too late

ENTRY.NAME: Paisano
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, vied boldly inside lane, spent late

ENTRY.NAME: Tamanrassett
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied early, chased to lane, appeared to hang, came again,

ENTRY.NAME: Uncle Jerome
ENTRY.COMMENT: not involved

ENTRY.NAME: Holy Truth
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, angled out to lane, vied late 6 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Seven and Seven
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent clear, rated on lead, inside lane, held on late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 8300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE DECEMBER 19, 2022. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HARD ASTRAY hustled clear moved off on pace building a comfortable margin into upper stretch finishing with plenty left along the inside. VOLTE FACE slow early gave a mild rally on the far turn emerging off a loose leader in upper stretch making no headway on the winner a clear second best. TOMMY TUESDAY off slowly lagged to upper stretch mustering a mild rally there to best the others. KREWE CHIEF tracked the pace chasing in vain on the far turn flattening out in upper stretch. PONT DU GARD was never involved. KITCHI stalked the early pace wilting abruptly on the far turn. JACK THE RIPPER (FR) gave a modest middle move then flattened out on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Hard Astray
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled clear, moved on pace, saved ground to lane, had more

ENTRY.NAME: Krewe Chief
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, chased far turn, flattened out lane

ENTRY.NAME: Pont Du Gard
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Tommy Tuesday
ENTRY.OWNER: Gray Christopher L and Gray Melissa R
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, lagged to lane, mustered mild rally to best others

ENTRY.NAME: Jack the Ripper (FR)
ENTRY.COMMENT: modest middle move, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Volte Face
ENTRY.OWNER: Bernardini Jay P and Carlino David
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, mild rally far turn, emerged lane, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Kitchi
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, wilted far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Special Weight Purse 16500. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HUNTER JUMPER went evenly through the turn circling out to upper stretch coming late with a seven wide run arriving in time. LITTLE VAQUERO pressed the pace wresting the lead three deep at the quarter pole digging in from the two path down the lane ceding late to wide pressure. SOUTHPOINT angled in near the seven sixteenths pole cutting the corner to upper stretch vying willingly there along the rail. MR MAYHEM slow early gained along the inside in mid stretch vying late from the two path. MY HOMBRE pressured the pace racing inside through the turn ceding in upper stretch wearing down late. FOGGY ALBION slow early raced nine wide down the lane. VASY SAYS NYET pressed the pace moving between horses at the quarter pole fading in upper stretch. BLACK BULL played no factor. UNKEMPT was never involved. BALLOT BOX was always outrun. PER RULING #129 FROM THE WEST VIRGINIA RACING COMMISSION, HUNTER JUMPER WAS DISQUALIFIED FROM 1st TO UNPLACED DUE TO A POSTIVE TEST.

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Hunter Jumper
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, lost ground to lane, came late 7 wide, in time

ENTRY.NAME: My Hombre
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, weakened inside

ENTRY.NAME: Unkempt
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Southpoint
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled rail 7/16, cut corner to lane, vied willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Vasy Says Nyet
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, between foes 1/4, faded lane

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Mayhem
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, inside move to lane, gained two path

ENTRY.NAME: Little Vaquero
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, led three deep 1/4, dug in two path, run down

ENTRY.NAME: Black Bull
ENTRY.COMMENT: played no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Ballot Box
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Foggy Albion
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, 9 wide lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 5 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 83. Claiming Purse 12400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 19 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $6,500 (Claiming Races For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: QUICK ENTRY tracked evenly through the turn angling to mid track in upper stretch surging late getting up late four deep. AWESOME MINER pressed a narrow lead through the turn into upper stretch digging in late under outside pressure drifting a touch near the end. LUCKY JUNIOR slow early lost ground to upper stretch coming with a rush late seven wide. HEARTNESS slow early saved ground to upper stretch finding late stride to finish strong along the rail. I'M A COOL MAN pressured the pace dueling through the turn extending in upper stretch steadying between horses near the wire as the rider seemed off balance late. JOSHY JAK hustled out drew even three deep at the quarter pole then weakened in upper stretch. DONNELS CREEK raced evenly in mid pack lacking surge down the lane. NOT A GAME faded on the turn. WARRIOR'S REMARK was always outrun, FOLLOWING A TRAINERS OBJECTION AWESOME MINER WAS DISQUALIFIED AND PLACED FIFTH FOR INTERFERENCE WITH I'M A COOL MAN NEAR THE WIRE.

ENTRY.NAME: Quick Entry
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked evenly, angled out lane, surged mid track, in time

ENTRY.NAME: Warrior's Remark
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Heartness
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, saved ground to lane, finished strong rail

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Awesome Miner
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, clung to lead turn, dug in lane, drifted a tough

ENTRY.NAME: I'm a Cool Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, dueled turn, between horses lane, steadied late

ENTRY.NAME: Donnels Creek
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly mid pack, lacked late response,

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Junior
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, lost ground to lane, came with arush 7 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Not a Game
ENTRY.COMMENT: faded on the turn

ENTRY.NAME: Joshy Jak
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled out, pressed three deep turn, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 6 5F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 9000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 19 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $6,500 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PAUL DRAKE raced evenly early inside angling out into upper stretch emerging in the six path running down foe in the last yards. SANTIAGO'S CAT pressed the pace wresting a clear lead at the quarter pole widening in the three path upper stretch angling to mid track under late pressure ceding grudgingly. CAJUN BAYOU slow early raced inside to upper stretch finishing well along the rail. EDUARD slow early lost ground to upper stretch gaining a bit there while eight wide. REGAL HOLIDAY played no factor. INGERSOLL in close early pressured between horses through the turn then faded in upper stretch. XIT NOW sent hard pressured through the turn tiring in upper stretch. FARMHAND in close early pressured four deep through the turn wearing out in upper stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Bayou
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, inside to lane, finished well on rail

ENTRY.NAME: Regal Holiday
ENTRY.OWNER: Gray Christopher L and Gray Melissa R
ENTRY.COMMENT: played no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Paul Drake
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly inside, angled 6 wide lane, surged up late, in time

ENTRY.NAME: Eduard
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, lost ground to lane, gained a bit 8 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Xit Now
ENTRY.OWNER: Ciampi Louis and Bernardini Jay P
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent hard, pressed pace, tired lane

ENTRY.NAME: Santiago's Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, clear 1/4, widened lane, angled out, grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Ingersoll
ENTRY.COMMENT: in close early, pressed pace, faded lane

ENTRY.NAME: Farmhand
ENTRY.COMMENT: in close early, pressed four deep through turn, wore out

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 7 5F Dirt CR: 70. Allowance Purse 23800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JUNE 19, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 19 Allowed 3 lbs. (Claiming Races For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Estimating Allowances) (Preference To Highest Earnings In 2022-2023).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MACKENZIE'S MUSIC pressed a short lead through the turn shaking clear in upper stretch adding on while ridden out as much the best. ULTRA DIVA slow early saved ground to upper stretch rallying from the rail getting up for place. CHURCH KEY chased through the turn angling four wide in upper stretch finishing evenly. COACH MACHEN pressed then chased on the turn angling out under left hand urging in upper stretch drifting wide while weakening late. WINDSOR'S PLAY pressed with early speed then gave way in upper stretch. GOT ANY played no factor. PAINTED ROCKET trailed throughou.

ENTRY.NAME: Church Key
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased through turn, 4 wide lane, missed place

ENTRY.NAME: Got Any
ENTRY.COMMENT: played no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Mackenzie's Music
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed short lead, edged off top lane, won much the best

ENTRY.NAME: Ultra Diva
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, saved ground to lane, up for place inside

ENTRY.NAME: Coach Machen
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed then chased on turn, drifted out lane, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Painted Rocket
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Windsor's Play
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed early, gave way lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 7900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 19 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAMALONA away alertly nursed a short lead through the turn kicking clear in upper stretch being ridden out. LELAWALA slow early gained some on the turn rallying along the inside down the lane to save place. MOONLIGHT MISS chased the pace through the turn extending on the rail down the lane hanging late. SWEET VALERIA a step slow through the turn raced evenly down the lane failing to menace. G MONEY LIV pressed then chased to upper stretch wearing out there. NURSE KATIE ducked out at the break. PREMIER WISH raced second flight tiring in upper stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: G Money Liv
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed then chased to lane, wore out

ENTRY.NAME: Lelawala
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, raced inside to lane, rallied up for place

ENTRY.NAME: Moonlight Miss
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, extended on rail lane, hung

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Valeria
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Mamalona
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace, drew off lane, ridden out,

ENTRY.NAME: Premier Wish
ENTRY.COMMENT: second flight, tired,

ENTRY.NAME: Nurse Katie
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out at break
